Reviews.Title: Nikon Guy finds S9300 mediocre and over priced
Reviews.Author: Ed911 "Alienplayer"
Reviews.Content: I'm sure I either have a bad copy...or some of the reviewing users here haven't put it through it's paces.My problems:1. S9300 will not lock focus when zoomed at or near it's maximum.2. Selecting one of the Auto ISO ranges...125-800 ISO causes the camera to select very low shutter speeds, so that even with vibration reduction, if you are shooting people, the imgages are soft...appearing OOF...out of focus. (Unacceptable for this price range.)3. The facial recognition feature, if used on anything but faces...will most often select something other than what you want to focus on...and since this is a menu driven feature, if you're switching between sceens, like at a birthday party, it's a pain to use.4. Generally speaking, the images leave a lot to be desired across the board.  And, this is the general consensus of online reviews...rating the camera a "C" as very average.  I have to agree.5. Portrait mode is way too cool...and there is no way to adjust the color temp in any mode except Auto.  Or from the menu when in Auto...again, for the price, this is unacceptable.6. And this is a biggie...I have lost confidence in the camera's ability to capture the shots that I want.I tried to like it...I shot over 200 images...and very few were keepers.  I had a Canon Elf S600...and it took better images than this model...and the Canon S600 is 4 years old.I have called Nikon and asked for an RMA and am returning S9300 for a refund. Bottom line, for $349.00, this camera is a poor to average performer...yeilding good to mediocre images.I don't disagree that if you are outside in bright light that it takes pretty good images...but, still not up to my expectations for the price tag.I cannot in good conscience recommend this camera to friends or anyone else.Like I said in my opening statement...I may have a bad copy.  These are just my findings on the copy that I received...Not a happy camper here...UPDATE: Going on vacation soon and wanted a better point and shoot.  Purchased the Nikon P7700 compact point and shoot.  I am thrilled to say that this is more like what I was looking for when I bought the S9300.  There are lots of external controls...more is better...such as a thumb wheel to adjust your exposure on the fly...way cool.Image quality is first rate at this price point($399.00.)  It is bigger than the S9300 and doesn't have the zoom range...but it does zoom optically to the equivalent of 200mm.  Nice.Just check out the P7700 here at Amazon...you won't be sorry.I see Nikon has yanked the S9300 and replaced it with an S9500...so, reviews weren't wrong...to bad for current S9300 owners.  I wonder if Nikon will be offering a discount on the new S9500, if you send in your S9300.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, could use some updates.
Reviews.Author: Rcubed
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera since i lost my canon powershot sd900.  I only buy canon products but since nikon has been advertising the heck out of their products i thought i give it a chance.  Overall this camera takes awesome photos. The in camera features are great as well.  My only problem is that in order to review your photos you have to turn on the camera you just can't press the review button.  When you do take a photo it takes forever for the preview to disappear. You can either have it on or off.  With canon it gave you the option of 1,2 or 3 second preview.  The last thing is that the flash is in an awkward place but as i was looking at the canon website every company is going to that format.  I would recommend this camera to someone though.Rcubed.

Reviews.Title: Great little Nikon
Reviews.Author: Fodder
Reviews.Content: Being a happy user of Nikon dSLR's and also my camera of choice for most stuff, there are still certain benefits in a good compact. My last compact being an olympus, which was a very disappointing experience. All the nikons I have owned in the past have always had a good build quality so that's what swung it for this one. When I purchased this camera it was brand new to the market so there was limited reviews but mostly positive. The Lumix zs20 nearly got my money as it is also a fantastic compact with similar spec but i'm a sucker for the nikon brand so I took the plunge. First impressions were that it is smaller then I expected, which is a good thing to me as that is the point of a compact right. The build quality seems good as do the ergonomics. Have taken a few hundred shots with it and am very impressed. Low light shots are particularly good with very low noise. The 18 x zoom is silent, quick and very smooth with decent optics, my only complaint being that at the maximum reaches and the camera being so small it is hard to hold steady enough for a sharp image but that is probably the issue on any small camera with a long lens. Great glove box or travel camera that can be recharged from anything with a USB. Very pleased with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: ef37
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use as a point and shoot camera when I didn't want to carry my SLR.  Given that I have been so happy with my Nikon DSLR purchase, I thought I would by happy with this purchase.  The design of the camera is terrible and the flash is located in a terrible place that is very inconvenient.  The biggest problem that I have though is the fact that this camera takes mostly blurry pictures.  I would think the idea of a point and shoot is that you can grab it out of your bag and just take a picture.  I recently took a trip to colorado and took a bunch of pictures only to find that most of them had awful color balance and were extremely blurry.  I really couldn't be more disappointed in my purchase and I am going to try and figure out if I can return it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, super photos, a bit annoying flash
Reviews.Author: sailor
Reviews.Content: So I bought this camera 6 months ago and have used it steadily ever since.  I've been a photographer for over 40 years and its a good quality device.There have been no failures and I've had relatively little trouble learning to use it on the fly.  (Although I admit I used the instruction manual once!) I've used the camera in below zero conditions in the snow, backpacking, in low light, in the rain as well as in bright sunlight.  It performs excellently in all conditions, giving good crisp and clear photos.  Of course, this means that you've actually taken the time to compose the shot ahead of time. No camera will compensate for poor set up.  It has never froze, or given me an error message.As with any new camera there are some things you have to learn to do differently.  I've adjusted to the fact that the flash pops up under where I usually put my left index finger and never think about it.I'd recommend the camera as a good all around camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon customer service is terrible
Reviews.Author: Christopher H. Snyder "snyder007"
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for 3 months of light use, when the lens mechanism failed and I had to ship it to Nikon for service.  It has been on "Parts Hold" for 3 weeks, and any attempt to get more information or request a simple replacement has been impossible.  The person you can talk to knows very little and will not forward you to someone with more authority to help.  The company seems to care very little about customer satisfaction, and I am worried about the overall quality of this camera based on the early failure of the lens system. Also, why does the Nikon service center have to wait for weeks to get parts from Asia?  It seems at least one other reviewer on this site its having the same experience.  I doubt that I will ever buy another Nikon product.  Oh, by the way, the picture quality is OK.  Chris Snyder

Reviews.Title: Worst Service Ever....
Reviews.Author: Tom Wilson
Reviews.Content: The camera was good for the first two months, but then the lens jammed.  I sent it to the Nikon Service center, where it has been for a month waiting for a part.  Nikon now tells me they expect the part in 3 more weeks.  7 weeks for a part for a new camera?  That makes no sense.  I asked to talk to someone about a replacement or some alternative to another month without, but was stonewalled at every turn.  This is my last Nikon, that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: Loving my new camera!
Reviews.Author: DeathByDenim
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix s9200 to replace my Nikon Coolpix P80, which still works perfectly fine, but I want a more portable camera. And since the s9200 was 50% off this Thanksgiving, I bought it.I really like this camera for a few reasons. It worked well straight out of the box, and better once I read the manual(read your manuals people). I like that it does fit in my pockets(the shorter girl pants pockets, not the deep manly pants pockets. Tho it would fit those also). It will take a burst of shots, which is great when chasing a toddler and trying to get one really good facial expression. I love the 18x optical zoom. I looove a good optical zoom. It also does very well tracking faces, up to nine(so says manual, personally I've seen it focus on 3 faces in the same shot, and they were all in focus at different distances from the camera). I like that I can turn off the option to preview my photos as they are taken(the 2 sec screen freeze before being able to take another picture).I have used this camera indoors and out, both with plenty of shots I liked. My approach to amateur photography is to take a ton of photos, then go through and pull out the few that were great. 16 megapixels also gives room to go through and crop your pictures later without losing some quality, although I try to frame my shots as I take them.The flash is in an awkward place, where you want to put your left index finger, which takes some getting used to, but is not worth avoiding the camera.I would recommend this to everyone I know. I have not found any major negatives.Please note that the battery charger for this camera plugs into the camera with the battery inside. You can pick up and extra battery and dedicated charger for under ten bucks on amazon(I did).

Reviews.Title: not reliable
Reviews.Author: Marilynn Higgins
Reviews.Content: I bought this in May of 2011. Within 5 days of getting it, the lens failed and I brought it to an authorized Nikon repair person in Warwick, Rhode Island. He determined the lens was defective and was replaced, finally, under warranty. It took about 6 weeks for the replacement parts to come in. Then this spring it stopped working again so I returned to the same shop and this time he says it can't be fixed. He does not sell cameras so his word is believable I think. He has done work before on my DSLR Pentax, so I know he does good work. He says he is always disappointed in the reliability of Nikon point and shoot cameras. He says to buy a Canon SX and I'll be happy and it will never need repair.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9300
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "gatorlandkali"
Reviews.Content: First thing, I purchased this camera not in Amazon but I found one store in my area that is cheaper with extra stuff with it. However, Amazon did gave me enough information to decide which digital camera I will buy to add to my photography pieces. I owned Canon DSLRs and I don't like Nikon DSLRs but I am surprised by this camera handled the way I want it to be, point and shoot, portable and it gives me freedom to adjust my photos just "like" my DSLR. I took several photos in every angles in comparison to DSLRs and there are few things that it doesn't have that edge in comparison to DSLR but it has the ability to mimic the DSLR. I like the Nikon Coolpix S9300 because the controls are "easy" to navigate unlike those expensive digital P&S; camera that you only paying for its name but the quality isn't.Second, if you decide to buy a digital camera, take this instead. A little heavy, sturdy [unlike those ones that are made of light plastics], you need a tripod if you use to zoom in small or distant subjects so there will be no shaking, battery is acceptable, lots of features that you will like. Geo-tagging or GPS is nice but I'm not a concern about it because what I'm concerned are the photos I take.Lastly, if you compare digital cameras from one to another be sure to compare resolution, sturdiness and quality of the camera because most of us like to keep it longer and serves us best.

Reviews.Title: Worst Auto Focus EVER !
Reviews.Author: J. Kuhr
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for a trip to Scandanavia, read all the instructions and did what I was supposed to.  No matter what mode I set the autofocus in I got blurry faces.  I tried Autofocus Mode in Single AF and Full Time both.  I tried AF area mode on Face Priority, Auto, Center and Subject Tracking.  All my pictures with people in them are blurry.  Scenery shots are fine.What a disapointment !  A $350 camera that I ca'nt count on.  My daughters $120 Canon takes better pictures without any fuss.

Reviews.Title: Broke within months, and inquiring into tech support online gave me nothing but spam
Reviews.Author: Pretzelcuatl
Reviews.Content: The title of my review says it all.  A few months after purchasing this camera, I started to have problems with the mode dial.  I'd turn on the camera, and get a warning screen that said "MODE DIAL NOT IN PROPER POSITION", and the camera would shut down.  Googling this problem indicated that I was far from alone with this.  I wrote to Nikon, submitting a request for help, and got a stream of offers to buy more Nikon products, but never received an answer to my question.  I'm going to keep trying, but in the meantime, this is my last purchase from this company.  The scoundrels.  The dirty, rotten jerks.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Nikon!!
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a week now and I love it.  I really went back and forth between this one and the P510.  I chose this one for my upcoming trip to Europe due to the size.  My husband wanted to fit it in his pocket.  It is a great camera.  I'm so glad I chose this one.  It has terrific features (that I'm still learning) for great photos.  The zoom is pretty impressive (obviously not as impressive as the P510). I guess the true test will be my trip.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9300
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Originally had an S9100 and thought it was terriffic.  We take lots of pictures monthly because of our work and it eventually quit working efficiently.  Still, a very good camera.  We then purchased the S9300 and we have think it is a piece of junk.  It doesn't take pictures quickly, the battery lid opens all the time and the telescoping feature takes forever.  I wish we had stayed with the S9100.

Reviews.Title: Nikon fan NOT happy for the first time
Reviews.Author: S. Ulivi
Reviews.Content: I have always had Nikon.  Have a couple of DSLR's and love them, and was looking for a small point and shoot to have on trip I cannot take my DSLR.  But Nikon in this one went bust.  It is extremely slow Camera.  Forget about it if you are in a hurry to take a shot.  By the time it turns on, you depress the shoot bottom it focuses and refocuses, charges the flash although you don't need it, the "nikon" moment passes.  I tried returning it but the 30 day trial had gone by, so now I'm trying to sell it secondary market.  Not worth your money.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S9300
Reviews.Author: J. Lindner
Reviews.Content: I love Nikon cameras.  I am very pleased with my D3100 and the several lenses I bought for it.  So when I decided I also wanted a point and shoot, I was not surprised when my list of desired features for my camera led me to select the Nikon S9300.  I was confident my purchase would justify my evaluation of the several cameras available.  But I am somewhat disappointed with this camera.  At face value it seems to match up to the competition, but there is something missing with the camera as a whole.  Let me explain what I mean.The autofocus seems to work well, but once I download my pictures, they are not always clear.  They appear clear in the view window when I take the picture, but the end result is not always what I expected.  Likewise, the selector dial on the camera is easily rotated, even when I do not want to change the setting.  It is as if the dial gets bumped or adjusted when I return my camera to my pocket or to its case.  The flash settings also seem to get changed without my knowing.  I set the flash to automatic, take some shots then return the camera to the case.  When I ready for my next shot, the flash is on a setting other than automatic.  These issues are annoying (though by themselves are not necessarily a dealbreaker).  I realize I likely am part of the reason for my problems, but my old Olympus point and shoot never gave me these problems.  Perhaps Nikon's desire to have multiple features is also part of the problem.  In their attempt to make this camera user friendly, they overlooked the fact that not every user will be proficient in all aspects of its use.On the positive side, the pictures that are in focus are great.  Many of my pictures are of a work related nature (building mechanical equipment, roofs, driveways, etc.) so I'm not talking about missing out on the perfect "Kodak moment," but I do rely on my camera to capture a picture so I do not have to write the thousand words I'd otherwise need to write.  The zoom lens is very powerful, though maximum zoom requires either a tripod or a very stable hand, and the pixel settings allow for well defined detail shots.  The GPS helps remind me where I was when I took the picture.I do not regret buying this camera.  Afterall, it was the only camera that had all of the features I was looking for in a point and shoot.  I just think that Nikon could have done a better job in constructing the camera so to avoid these bothersome issues.  It is a comfortable camera to bring along on any type of outing.  For these reasons I say this is a good camera, just not a great camera.  My old Olympus lasted me eleven years before a mysterious hole developed in my viewfinder and I could no longer load the software on new computers.  I wonder how long the Nikon S9300 will last.

Reviews.Title: Cool Cam
Reviews.Author: Elaine MAC
Reviews.Content: I appreciate the convenience of this small purse/pocket sized point and shoot camera which makes it easy for me to have it abailable when I want it.  It is much faster to shoot, refocus and frame than my previous camera, and the zoom is quite effective for such a small camera.  It is what I had been looking for.

Reviews.Title: Will not lock focus when zoomed at or near maximum
Reviews.Author: The Engineer Critic
Reviews.Content: Couple of comments:1) Auto-focus takes awhile.  When zoomed in completely, auto-focus usually skips over the position where it's focused and locks in where it's blurry.  Sometimes it helps to push the shutter half-way a couple more times (each time it locks at a different point).2) There is no manual focus override.3) The USB connector is non-standard, requiring a special Nikon-compatible USB cable.  (I do like the USB charging ability, though)

Reviews.Title: Used as concert camera...
Reviews.Author: Jana
Reviews.Content: I'm far from a true professional when it comes to photography and especially concert photography but I've been to 80+ concerts. Every show I've been to I've always gotten pictures not worth talking about, well finally my go to camera died and I bought this one. I'm glad I did. I've used it at 3 concerts so far and it did amazing even at full zoom. I've never had such beautiful pictures from a concert. I will agree the battery is less than perfect so I bought a back up and it's just fine. I've posted some of my concert pictures in the user photos of this product for you to view.The video: AMAZING at a concert too! The HD puts out amazing footage. This is primarily a concert use camera for me.If you are a concert go-er and serious about getting some good shots, I recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Not what expected
Reviews.Author: Nana Nut "Happy healthnut"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for an upcoming Alaska cruise, mainly because of the zoom capability.  Unfortunately I had problems with the zoom not staying in focus.  I was extremely disappointed in this camera and returned it after only three days.

Reviews.Title: Remove battery and it goes brain dead
Reviews.Author: howard
Reviews.Content: For me -- taking pictures of non-mobile, inanimate objects -- the camera does what I want.  The pictures come out sharp, and I have no complaints there.  Others have issues with the slow turn around time between photos.  I agree that this is *not* a good camera for sporting events or taking pictures of the kids (when you want to take a bunch of pictures quickly so that you can select the best one later).Personally, I selected the S9300 specifically for the GPS feature.I have two gripes against the camera:1.  If you remove the battery, the settings -- at least whether to include GPS location information -- gets reset back to the factory default.  I missed the GPS information on a number of shots due to this "feature."2.  My camera doesn't charge very well through the USB -- meaning that I have to remove the battery and put it in the external charger.  Which brings me back to issue #1.If I had known all the limitations of this camera before I bought, I probably still would have, but I would have started with a completely different set of procedures.  I would have started out with a spare battery and the car recharger to ensure that I always had a fresh battery.  I also would go through all the menu options each time after changing the battery to ensure they were set the way that I wanted them.This camera does not inspire loyalty to Nikon.  If another camera comes out with similar features and price point -- but doesn't go brain dead every time you replace the battery -- I'll go with it instead.

Reviews.Title: A Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Mickey
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations of this camera.  Have never owned a camera with such a terrible shutter lag between shots.  It's hard to push in the "on" button and it takes forever for the lens to move out and be ready to take a picture.  The flash is in an awkward place and usually hits my left hand where I'm holding the camera.  The image stabilization feature is not great - have experienced a lot of blurry pictures.  The 18X zoom feature and video are the only things I like about this camera.  Feel I've wasted my money simply because of the long shutter lag between shots - miss a lot of shots because of that.  Will not purchase another Nikon compact.

Reviews.Title: It is nikon, but...
Reviews.Author: marian bolf
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to shoot some nice pics with the kids and when traveling light, right out of the box we were getting the "lens error" message, it would go away after restart, then after 2 restarts, that's when we decided to send it back... The pictures were ok as long as we didn't use the "full auto" mode, in full auto almost all of the pics are blurry. Really nice photos if you use the scene selector thou.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: William A. Fuller "The Old Bald Dude"
Reviews.Content: Bought a refurb from Amazon owned Woot.com. Horrible experience, and even worse camera. Can't send it back, because that's the way Woot works. Nikon says it meets manufacturer specs. But, I'm very experienced with both DSLRs & Point & Shoots and I have maybe 30 to 40 of 500+ shots that I managed to get in focus. Stuff that inexpensive cameras have no problem with are impossible with this turkey. Bought it because I got a message from Amazon that Woot had a superzoom Nikon for $100. Might as well have flushed the $100 down the toilet. Turned off all Amazon notifications for their affiliated companies after this mess. Neither the autofocus nor the anti shake features work well enough for this camera to be usable. Nikon told me today that it meets their specs, and since I bought it from Woot, I'm seriously stuck. Going to toss it in the trash, because it's not something I could sell to someone else and sleep at night. A real dog of a camera.

Reviews.Title: my bad choice had to return it back
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera with high expectation trusting the brand name.  i was disappointed when i started using it.clarity of snaps were highly unpredictable, i read manual and tried different combinations but nothing seemed to fix the issue.photos taken during Day time were some what better compared to the ones taken during night time.there were too many blurry photos and i don't have any idea on what was causing it. at times it took great photos and all of sudden for no reason it starts taking blurry pictures.i purchased this camera hoping to take some nice snaps during holiday season, when it was really the occasion this camera totally disappointed me,  my smartphone took much reliable photos compared to this camera.pop out flash was another annoying feature.Amazon provided great service both during delivery and when i had to return it back.

Reviews.Title: Low Light Capability Disappointing
Reviews.Author: North Country Artisans (Linda)
Reviews.Content: This camera's low light performance is dismal. I took it to a concert in a small, not very well lit venue and both photos and videos were dark or blurry and mostly both. Out of frustration, I put the camera away and used my iPhone 4. Every photo and video from the phone's camera was near perfection. I replaced the Nikon with a SONY DSC-HX30V, more expensive to be sure, but in nearly every way, well worth the money. Its low light performance is excellent compared to the S9300.Otherwise, in general, the shots I took with the Nikon were a little softer than I prefer. On the plus side, the selective color function surpassed my SONY Nex series DSLR. Other artistic effects worked very well.

Reviews.Title: great camera forget all the bad reviews they cant use a camera!!!
Reviews.Author: ravi
Reviews.Content: forget all the bad reviews and what other nonsense all the other people were saying this is an amazing camera this is my 4th nikon and i love all and this one by far is my favorite.okay now for the rest of you idiots that said the camera doesn't focus when zoomed in all the way you hold the button down not all the way but some what all the way down and it will focus in orCHANGE YOU SETTINGS  and for mr NIkon please do not call your self mr Nikon if you dont have a brain in your head to insult a great camera like this making it sound horrible. This camera is amazing as hell its so clear it feels like you can reach in and touch the pictures. i dont know if you all got bad products but i for one can honestly say this is by far an amazing camera. the picture quality kills even a Canon t3I have just compared pictures from both and i can say that the nikon won by a long shot. it makes nature seem like you cut it out and brought it to your computer or print it onto a canvas. Nikon has always been a great camera brand this camera keep its good name up. Like i said before maybe the people who gave it bad reviews got a bad batch or something but this camera is amazing and works flawlessly.I will update this review constantly when anything changes. but for now i dont see anything changing about how amazing this camera is .

Reviews.Title: Great pictures at an affordable price
Reviews.Author: adknative
Reviews.Content: The quality of these high-resolution pictures can be achieved with other cameras... other cameras will also take fast-action shots clearly, or panoramic scenes... crystal-clear close-ups or breath-taking long-distance zoom photos.  Few cameras can rival the precision and accuracy of the true colours, though... and to have a camera which does all of the above, uses long-lasting rechargeable lithium batteries, has an incredibly easy menu, fits in your pocket for a weekend hike or camp-out (or holiday road-trip) ... and costs so much less than high-end professional cameras?  I've used Kodak, Panasonic, Canon, Olympus, Sharp and Nikon cameras for over thirty years... I wrecked a $400 Minolta while on a caving trip, when grit got into the gears.  My last three cameras have been Nikon: I can catch a bee sipping dew from a flower with the same clarity I get shooting a panoramic from the High Peaks, or a sunset over the lake.  I get vibrant reds without the edge of red 'jumping' into the nearby pixels, or the blur you get with some cameras.  My sunsets & autumn foliage have brilliantly sharp colour, and snowshoeing through rime-frost forests at below-zero temps won't faze this camera any more than hot summer days kayaking out on the water.  This is the affordable, take-anywhere camera you always wish you had in your pocket when you just missed a great picture...!

Reviews.Title: Mediocre
Reviews.Author: Rory
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a good compact to compliment a SLR with all the lens that I don't like lugging about and instead of a cell phone camera. Looked pretty on paper but it comes up lacking in a few areas.- Charging - non standard lead - drives me nuts as I cannot have one lead for phones, cameras, gadgets etc. It has been a brick for weeks on end as I can't find the stupid proprietary USB cable. Just use a microUSB - please!- layout - the buttons are not in the best places. ON/OFF is just a monumental PIA- startup - this is not quick. Don't expect to capture the UFO that unexpectedly flies past- photo quality - more kwality than quality. It just doesn't seem to nail the focus quite right. As a result the pictures are ok but they do not stand out.Overall it's ok but not $350 ok. $200 max.

Reviews.Title: Full ZOOM photos all blurry.
Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: Two days ago I purchased this Nikon coolpix S9300 because I like having a LONG ZOOM in a compact on a 'good' camera. I always keep camera in my purse for many everyday nature, objects, and people shots.  So far I have only shot a few pictures and I'm not happy with the zoom, flash and included camera bag.Do I need to settle for a camera (and another brand) with a zoom not as wide (maybe 10x) so my zoom photos are not blurry?I don't need the GPS, nor the 3D elements. Did this camera come down much lower in price because of problems?-  1. I took about a dozen shots of a foot-long lizard a yard away at almost and full ZOOM. Nikon would NOT focus. I deleted all but two shots that were a total blur. Is this a regular problem?-  2. The manual, page 60, says:"When not using the flash, gently push to lower the flash until it clicks shut."I think this is a possible problem issue having to manually push down FLASH.  Pop up FLASH does not automatically go back at shut off. I don't like that I must do the FLASH pushing back in when camera is turned off.- (In addition, I don't like that the flash is located where normally my left finger would be holding the camera steady.)-  3. I found the ON/OFF button NOT convenient. It is deep.-  4. This is not a camera issue but: The Nikon leather and elastic camera BAG with the camera purchase (elsewhere) is ridiculous having FOUR large open corners allowing dirt, sand, water, etc. to enter bag.Impossible to make MAGNET flap closure work. (Not an Amazon bag purchase and Amazon is a much better price for camera.)+  I think the little rubber strip on back is good to help prevent finger from turning on video.? Can someone please let me know the best way to keep with me an EXTRA CHARGED BATTERY because the Nikon camera must be plugged in to get the battery charged? What's your suggestion? (I sure hope the battery indicator lights works because the last Nikkon S8200 I had didn't have a working battery indicator. It always died without any warning!)(It was easier with AA batteries in my old Canon, with a viewfinder which I miss.)Please let me know if you also have these issues.Maybe I should return this 9300.  What camera should I buy for my needs?  HELP.  Thank you for helping me.

Reviews.Title: Great little Camera
Reviews.Author: X. Chen
Reviews.Content: Got the 9200 for a friend, testing out right now so I can teach him how to use it.Took a few pictures while I'm at it, works fine.Pros:-priceat $123.45 is darn cheap for a Nikon.-sizepretty small to think it can do 18x zoom.-Screenvery sharp.-SpeedFast shutter speed.Cons:-Chargeris weird can only charge with the Nikon charger and not with other USB chargers. Thinks it was connected to the computer, then later shows the battery is depleted when connected to my iPad charger!-Screenneeds screen protector for this one, too many finger prints after a short photo shoot.-Flashis at a weird place, first thought it didn't come with one, second thought I can manually pop it out, third only comes out when it wants to, and that makes a little weird when you are holding it.-BatteryTakes 3 hours 50min to full charge.Other:can only do 29m of video at one time. Tried both 32gb and 64gb flash card and both shows 29m for video.which is no problem unless you tried to filming some live shows.no reason to get 9300 unless GPS is your thing.

Reviews.Title: Read the book people!
Reviews.Author: SB Carver
Reviews.Content: This is a great product (S9200)and fulfills everything promised. There is a slight hitch though, as obvious as this sounds, you need to carefully read the manual. I don't mean to discount the occasional lemon someone has purchased, I experienced many of the complaints I read about in the reviews here. However, if you read the manual it explains what you are doing wrong to end up with blurred pictures and other complaints I've seen listed. Yup, user error can be taken care of by putting the time into the manual and tracking down the problem and what you, the consumer can do to correct it. That and practice! You can't use a tool/device effectively without getting to know what it can do. If you want a simple point and shoot with a 15 page, bilingual manual, don't get this one. This one has bite, this one can accomplish something besides taking pictures of the kids at the beach. This one can help you say something.Ok, now to the camera.Plus- The cost, only $150!!  The size, pocketable, not too heavy but definitely not unsubstantial. I like the feel.  The lens, yowza! 25-450mm for only $150? Great detail.  The settings, plenty of them! Remember, you can use the settings for other situations then the ones they suggest! Only your imagination is stopping you!  The preview screen, big and sharp!  Shutter lag, what shutter lag? I was shocked by the shots I'm getting! I push the button and it's WYSIWYG! This is going to be good.Minus- The auto focus can be a little cantankerous. I have a feeling there is something in the book that will help with that too. I'll keep looking, it is 80 pages long!  The battery life is reported to be not as long as some. They are right! The life does leave something to be desired. Get over it people! If you use your camera and keep an eye on the battery level you should do fine. If you need longer time out with it, get another battery! Did I mention it's only $150?For the price there isn't a better camera on the market for the money. Would I recommend it? I already have! If you want to get a great little camera, this is the one. And people? Read the manual.

Reviews.Title: The Camera is Great ..
Reviews.Author: TIMOTHY  W  MOE
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned .. Especially for night photos and the 18 X Zoom .. every thing works easily and perfectly for taking great photos .

Reviews.Title: Early experience with Nikon Coolpix s9300
Reviews.Author: Retlaw
Reviews.Content: My experience with the ordering process was excellent.  The product arrived on time and in good condition.  I was a little apprehensive since I had purchased the previous model of this camera and it failed to focus reliably.  Focusing is still the only issue I have with the S9300 but I don't know that I should expect it to perform like my Nikon SLR's.  Overall I am very pleased and picture quality is excellent except in some cases where focusing is not quite perfect.  I would probably rate the camera at 4 stars or higher.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures and Videos when zoomed
Reviews.Author: Maureen
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon ,being the #2 best seller point and shoot at that time..I'm very disappointed with the camera : when I use the zoom, the auto-focus is not working ,resulting in very very blurry picture of the objects (tried with various settings). Same goes for the video, when I zoom, the auto-focus just not working, in addition to annoying sound of zooming!. Am returning this item to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera That's Horribly Slow and Takes Horrible Pictures
Reviews.Author: MFA
Reviews.Content: This camera is horrible. It has a nice set of features but takes crummy pictures indoors at any distance, and the zoom is worthless outdoors past 5X. I've taken a hundred pictures using a Class 10 card and probably have a handful I'd be willing to share and print. Perhaps the worst thing about this camera is how slow it is = HORRIBLY SLOW! Tried to use it to take holiday card shots of my kids. Pressed half way down to focus then pressed... kept pressing... re-pressed... and after several seconds finally got the thing to take a picture, well past the kid's attention span. Ugh! This was my first Nikon experience and I will never try again. Buyer beware, this camera is Made in China and is horrible, horrible, horrible. Look elsewhere. Zero stars.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed after "real life" use...
Reviews.Author: Shawny
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a great point and shoot camera - but with more options than "normal" and faster. I thought I'd finally found it with this Nikon. But after a trip to the Zoo- I'm honestly thinking I'll take it back. I know it's not a SLR- so it's not going to be as quick- But come one, for this price point I expected it to work faster and get the shot. Unfortunately, it doesn't. It takes a moment to turn on and open the lense- THEN- you pretty much have to hold the button partially down to get it to focus and decide it's ready to take the picture... THEN, it finally takes the picture... but there were plenty of times, not sure why, I would try to just pull it out and shoot- and nothing. Wouldn't even attempt to take a picture? I got THE best SD card I could- and was told it would speed up the process etc... not so much. My other point & shoot (for less than 1/2 the price btw)- takes JUST as good pics and actually works a little faster. I was hoping this would be a good middle ground between the basic Point and Shoot and SLR. Not close. It would be fine if you want just typical pics- and some added features- but otherwise, save your money! :( Too bad!Maybe there is a setting that is off- but for this price, I would think the auto mode would pretty do it all????? Guess I was expecting too much maybe.

Reviews.Title: Download cable connection flimsy
Reviews.Author: C. wagoner "ottersea"
Reviews.Content: Bought this in June 2012 and after 5 months the cable connection failed. I should say it did not fail but because it was so flimsy when I inserted the cable into the camera the pins bent and now do not work. So I have a camera that I cannot download the photos or charge the battery. You would think that a name like Nikon would make something that costs over $300 a bit more robust then this flimsy piece of junk. Will never get another coolpix from them. Camera still works but now I have to get a dedicated card reader and charger. Only gets a 1 star because they won't let me give a 0 star rating.

Reviews.Title: A great camera with even greater price
Reviews.Author: Amazon fan
Reviews.Content: First things first !!! The two best things I liked about this camera are whopping 18X optical zoom and the 1080p HD movies it shoots.Being a hobbyist photographer, I myself own a Nikon D7000 with a couple of lenses which I use every time I try my hands on photography. Wanted to buy an easy to use point-and-shoot for a friend. Being a Nikon fan for life, my work on selecting the manufacturer was cut short. Now, all I had to choose was a model with decent resolution (above 8MP), good optical zoom and the capacity to use Li-Ion battery (I hate the cameras which use AA batteries!!!). This helped me zero down on a few available Nikon cameras.Finally I decided to but the S9200 and it was available at a good discount (49% when I bought it and its 59% now !!!!). Before handing it over to a friend, I tried my hands on it to make sure I got the right product. This camera didn't disappoint me at all. With its CMOS sensor, the clarity of the pictures is unmatched and 16MP gives you pictures which will not pixelate even if you zoom in to its limits. As  I said my favorite feature on the camera in its 18X optical zoom, meaning you can take macro shots of flowers (my favorite subjects while shooting with DSLR) with ease. This also comes in handy when you want to take shots of animals/birds/butterflies from a distant so that you don't disturb/scare them. 1080p HD movie is ideal to shoot any live scene (although that's not my favorite thing), but can be used with ease during any function and party. You see the effect of 1080p when you watch it on a PC or TV monitor. Although not very important, the high resolution screen shows you the images at awesome clarity.Two additional features I liked were the in-camera editing and panorama. With the in camera edit, you can add various effects to your photos and make them more appealing even before you copy them to your computer. I did use "Easy Panorama Mode" to make a panorama and was surprised to see the camera itself stitched all the images and I didn't need any post processing using third-party software !! This is something which many people would love to experiment with. A few other features worth mentioning are the Nikon's innovative VR image stabilization, 7 fps continuous shooting and considerably long battery life.A few people have listed endless number of issues with this camera. My point is that if you have all these problems, why not buy a DSLR instead of point and shoot. At this price, one cannot ask for features which are available in a DSLR camera. Another user complains that it is difficult to hold the camera still when you are zoomed out at 18x. Isn't that a practical problem???? You will have this with any point-and-shoot, because of its small size. I would suggest to use a tripod in such cases, instead of blaming camera which offers something which human beings can handle !!! A few other complaints by various users just make me laugh. It seems that they have mentioned those issues just for the sake of mentioning!! I feel that this camera provides you more than enough features for a starter or casual shooter at a reasonable price. I am happy that I got this (and my friend is also happily using it).

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted higher megapixel and zoom range than my old Panasonic Lumix and Sony point and shoot. I picked this based on how many positive reviews there were. It was my first Nikon and it will be my last one. I will never again waste my money on that brand! $349 town the toilet.Many other reviews address the problems as well. If you're shooting in daylight and the subject doesn't move, the camera is perfect. If you're shooting indoors and/or your subjects move and you don't want one blurred photo after another, get a different camera. I have tried changing every setting I could change and nothing gave me clean action shots.If that wasn't bad enough, the lag between shots is positively maddening. I count 5 seconds. Think that's not bad? Next time you see something you want to shoot, say "click" and then wait - 5 - se - co - nd - s. By the time you can take another photo, the action is over and that great shot is gone.I bought this camera last year and now I have to buy a new one. Not because this one broke -- it's fine. But because it's the worst camera I've ever owned and I'm tired of missing shots or getting only blurs.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in 10/2012.  It has a delay which causes the loss of many pictures.  The battery is terrible.  After only a few month, the battery won't hold a charge at all.  I used to think Nikon meant quality, but this camera is terrible.  I recommend you look else where.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: SHERRY TIMBERLAKE
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Walmart with the advice of their sales associate in the electronics department. It only worked for about a week. Walmart has a 15 day return policy. I took it back on the 16th day not knowing this. They said sorry, they could not help. I contacted Nikon, no help. I thought Nikon was one of the best. There are tons of reviews about how this camera will not hold a charge. It does not have batteries that can be replaced. It was a big disappointment. Just use your phone camera. It's a better option than this thing!

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Pravir Khandelwal
Reviews.Content: Poor quality pictures, no matter what setting you choose. I was attracted to the zoom ratio and pixel rating but at the end of the day, pictures were not sharp or good color.

Reviews.Title: Should have listened to negative reviews.
Reviews.Author: William B. Harden MD
Reviews.Content: When it works, it takes great pictures. Too slow and I don't understand why some pictures are blurry. If you need to take a picture in a hurry, forget it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: John Ruge
Reviews.Content: Have used the camera for about a  month.  It takes crisp clear photos.  The zoom works great.  I bought this camera because of the extended zoom.  Much more than the 3x or 5x of previous cameras I've owned.  So far I am very happy.  I'm not a photographer and don't know how to operate a manual camera with f stops and all that.  It works great for my purposes.  Still working on figuring out all the controls and features.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase anything from Crawford Superstore !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gardengal
Reviews.Content: I dropped my Nikon s9100 and damaged it beyond repair.  In a hurry, I went on Amazon and purchased a replacement, the Nikon s9300, a brand new one.  I have been shopping with Amazon for years without any problems.  (I did not know this was coming from Crawford Superstore).When the box arrived we opened it - and to our first surprise, it contained another box (not your normal Nikon packaging) that stated "Factory Renew"!  We opened the next box, a white cardboard box with a label stuck to it, again, not what you usually get from Nikon.....it contained a camera in a bubble wrap sleeve.  We took it out and it was obvious that it was either a floor model or someone's return.  The LCD monitor is scratched, no protective film as you would expect.  The charger was just thrown in the box along with the included CD and battery.  No packaging protecting anything.  This was sold to me as "New". This is most definitely a fraud.I contacted Amazon and told the representative on the phone what happened, and I was advised that they were there to help me.  An email was sent to Crawford Superstore asking them to contact me and make it right.  I received an email from Crawford Superstore today - not professional at all....."im sorry to hear that it looks like you got the wrong item please send it back we will get the correct item to you".Now let me tell you this, they are asking me to send it back at my expense????  I don't think so - they sent me a used camera and want me to pay for their mistake.  Any reputable company would jump through hoops to make sure they fixed an error on their part.  Also, after investigating their website, we discovered that they will charge me a 15% restocking fee for their mistake....I don't think so.  We will return this piece of junk to them and we will file a claim against them.  Crawford Superstore needs to send me a prepaid return label.  We just want our money back.We are waiting to see if Amazon really takes care of their customers.  After further research, it appears that we are not the only consumers that have been taken by Crawford Superstore.  We hope Amazon takes a hard look at this vendor and does the right thing to protect all of us!

Reviews.Title: lots of nice features
Reviews.Author: M. Garrett "eject_eject"
Reviews.Content: this camera was a replacement for a 1 1/2 y.o. Lumix DMC-SZ1 with 10x optical zoom and 14 mp.  the lumix developed dark spots on the sensor that showed up on bright images so it was retired.  as a comparison, the nikon is a bit thicker but about the same length and width which is nice for a pocket camera.  the display is good and controls are simple and easy to use.  image quality under maximum zoom is not as good as the Lumix nor does the 18x rating of the nikon seem to be any more than the 10x of the lumix.  under lower zoom conditions, the nikon seems to have better color outdoors but produces an orange hue under flourescent lighting, even with white balance set to either auto OR flourescent. using manual white balance  (or Photoshop) you can make the color better. otherwise, I would say a bit better in macro mode (which I use frequently for work) and overall the autofocus seems faster and less finicky than the lumix.  the big surprise however was the big selection of HD movie mode - not only does it record directly into iPhone compatible movies but also provides slow-motion recording at 1/2 and 1/4.  it also does high speed at 2x!  low light photos are only marginally better than the lumix but on the nikon you can improve the quality by locking the ISO speed to max out at either 400 or 800 - another great feature in my mind. so far I have only had the camera for 2 days but this is probably my 20th digital camera and I use them almost daily for work and pleasure.  if it continues to impress me, I'll come back and give it 5 stars but for now it only gets 4 due to low light performance and marginal resolution at high zoom levels.

Reviews.Title: Auto-Focus SUCKS!
Reviews.Author: K. stovall "stovk"
Reviews.Content: Why did Nikon bother putting an auto-focus on this product in the first place? I have missed so many great shots because the POS can't seem to focus on the subject 10 feet away. Don't bother trying to get an "action shot" It'll be over before the camera knows what to focus on (if it ever even does).Scenic shots seem to be a problem too. Distant hills and mountains? Cityscapes? The COOLPIX S9300 doesn't seem to know what Infinity is.Video? Forget it. Every video shot I take is out of focus.Don't waste your $$ on this piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: Decent For The Price...BUT With Issues
Reviews.Author: CinemaPete
Reviews.Content: I read previous reviews of the Nicon s9200 and most of them were favorable.  I was looking for a higher resolution, non-DSLR type camera for general use, and I didn't want anything overly complicated to deal with.  Overall, the camera does a decent job.  The camera is easiest to work with in auto mode, though it has some manual capability as well.  Color saturation was excellent and natural looking.  Some of the reviews said there were issues with focus.  In auto mode I did notice that some shots did not come out as sharply as I would have preferred and sometimes the camera had some difficulty maintaining focus even with a well-lighted subject.  For such a high resolution camera (16 mega pixels) I would have expected a better overall image than this camera seems to produce. In fact, my very ancient Sony Mavica MVC-CD500, purchased back in 2002, and which is only 5 mega pixels, can produce jaw-dropping images with razor-sharp accuracy. The s9200 also shoots 1080 video which is not bad at all.  The s9200 is relatively small and can accept SDHC cards for lots of images.  The preview screen on the rear is very large and bright.  Menu structure and navigation is typical but easy to use and understand.  While the camera has lots of features, there's not so much to this camera to get confused with. One issue with setting time on this camera is that it only uses military 24-hour format, there's no option for a more typical AM through PM format. The camera has a very solid feel to it and is solidly built.  The one really bad thing I noticed about its case design is the positioning of the automatic pop-up flash unit.  Unless you leave the flash unit in its up position, because of its location on the top left corner area of the camera - right where you're likely grab the camera with your left hand - if the camera decides it needs the flash, your hand will most likely prevent it from "popping up".  My advice is to leave the flash in its up position so your hand will accommodate holding the camera without the danger of preventing the flash from popping when needed - but then you need to watch that you don't put a finger in front of the flash. Zooming worked as expected but I did notice the camera had some difficulty with focusing so be sure you're not too close AND at the same time zoomed in or the camera will not properly focus. The camera's macro mode seemed to work, though it didn't seem to provide the ability to focus any better and seemed to have issues with focus. This camera does not use expendable replacement batteries but a proprietary rechargeable battery. The camera also comes with the usual software to download images from the camera to your PC and also has a panoramic stitching program.  I tried the stitching program and it takes a bit of using but it does work. There is a higher capability stitching program available for additional cost and if you will be doing panoramas you may want to upgrade to it.  For the price I paid ($ 150) this is a very usable camera.  However, if you're looking for better performance and better focus and sharpness, look to a different model or maker.UPDATE 10-2013: My original comments still apply and having had the Nikon S9200 for a couple of months now and having used it on two trips I cannot recommend it over a different make or model in spite of its good qualities:  Battery life is excellent; A single charge seems to last forever. Although the camera has some manual capabilities, I did not use them and have used it exclusively in AUTO mode.  However, even in AUTO mode, focus is a) unreliable at best and b) impossible to achieve when fully zoomed in on a subject even at a considerable distance from the subject. Macro mode does not seem to make any difference with focus and focus was inconsistent. I'm sorry to say that, after significant use, focus is simply unreliable.  Although the camera can take excellent shots much of the time, with very natural color saturation, the focus issue overrides all others (at least for me) and so you cannot depend on getting a clean and in-focus shot. I've also discovered significant parallax error with most shots requiring a visit to Photoshop to make corrections (may be the lens system or glass/sensor combination). So unless you know how to correct images with severe parallax error, have software that allows you to make such corrections, and you don't care about the time it takes, be prepared to edit many, if not all, your images. An additional annoyance I've discovered is the small flap on the right-side (when looking at the back of the camera) that hides the USB and HDMI output: You'll need to access the USB to charge the camera or use its HDMI output. When the flap is in place it is extremely difficult to open; there seems to be no tactile edge to grip so that one can easily open it. In fact this was so annoying to me (and I have the patience of a saint) that I actually ripped off and permanently removed the flap! The current price on Amazon is more than what I originally paid and while you can still get it from a 3rd party via Amazon (or elsewhere) for less than what Amazon is charging I would strongly advise to STAY AWAY from this particular Nikon model and get something else that does not have the severe focus issue this model seems to have.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9200
Reviews.Author: EF
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great size and capabilities for travel.It is virtually worthless because the battery and card storage door will NOT LATCH in a satisfactory manner.  Can't believe Nikon  put this junk on the market.  Unit returned(Amazon just great here) Purchased Canon SX260hs and am highly satisfied in all respects.

Reviews.Title: The worst camera ever !!!
Reviews.Author: Gizelly
Reviews.Content: I hated !!! I totally regreat..this camera is very slow..the pictures are terrible !! It's impossible to take pictures at night..The effects are so pour

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: CloverL
Reviews.Content: We just bought this camera as we were looking for a high quality camera that was not too large.  The flash is a bit annoying, but many good cameras are being made with a pop up flash now.  This camera takes great, quality pictures!  Overall, I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: disappointing, purchased used at Amazon
Reviews.Author: risinggr
Reviews.Content: I did considerable research before choosing this camera after my previous Nikon S6000 was ruined when the waterproof container I put it in while snorkeling in Hawaii turned out to have a warning against submerging. Anyway, this Nikon S9300 is supposed to take very clear pictures with very little light pollution (I think it's termed). Many of the pictures it has taken have been blurry, especially with a flash. I bought it used, so I am considering sending it to Nikon to see if there is a problem with the camera. But it may just be that I am not yet familiar with the proper settings to use for any given situation. I discovered later that I was on a different setting than the default when the pictures were blurry.

Reviews.Title: Have to know your camera
Reviews.Author: JAL reader "A Boston Reader"
Reviews.Content: Have owned 9300 after owning 9100 for 18 mo. Will admit taking clear pics with an aim and shoot camera seemed hit and miss until I realized my Nikon was very light sensitive and flash way to powerful. Hmmm. I take all my photos wheather indoor flash or outdoor sun with negative .3 to neg. 1.0  light compensation and 400 ISP and wow my pics are so much clearer. In many situations in addition try using useing filler flash With negative light compensation and  you will be amazed. I am now totally happy with quality of my pics just KNOWING my camera and basic photography.

Reviews.Title: tremendous camera !!!
Reviews.Author: chris gerard
Reviews.Content: I bought it really on a hurry, because I needed a good camera as an important event was nearing, and my old camera was completely useful.I totally recommend it !Quality of HD film are just so great, the menu is very simple and user friendly, the zoom is amazing, etc.etc.And I got a 30 % discount on the initial price.Thanks amazon !

Reviews.Title: BLURRY!!!! PICS everywhere!
Reviews.Author: Alvaro
Reviews.Content: day, night, sports,  etc you will go home and transfer the pics to your PC to notice your camera ruined your picture!!!!! this is the worst camera i ever had and guys, PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Sydna Magee
Reviews.Content: I am sad to say this nikon is NOT worthy of the name.  It is the worst camera I have ever owned.  Distortion is horrible, unlike any camera I have ever used!  You can't get a picture that isn't blurred! It is not user friendly and the trap door that contains the battery and card pops open constantly.  It doesn't automatically rotate photos to the right position for viewing so you have to turn the camera to see your shot.  I am absolutely amazed that nikon would produce a product this bad.

Reviews.Title: It has focus issues
Reviews.Author: Natalia Lopez
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of functions but it has a big problem with focusing. I have missed a lot of great pictures because of that, a lot of blurred photos.

Reviews.Title: Built to fail
Reviews.Author: Cathy S Crumpton
Reviews.Content: I got to use this camera one time. The charger cable was very difficult to plug into the camera, (you are warned not to force it - so expect to spend 10 minutes or so gently trying to slide it in place) but I eventually got it to plug in and charge. One time only! I sent it in for warranty repairs, but they are not going to cover it and want as much to repair it as I paid for it in the first place. I am extremely disappointed, and consider it a very expensive lesson. I will certainly never buy a Nikon product again. I am sure the product was defective to begin with, but I needed to use it. My advice is to try another brand.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the Amateur Photographer
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: When I was looking to purchase this model from Amazon's sister (step-son, whatever) site, woot, I read the reviews here and found most were written by those who know what they're talking about when it comes to cameras. That's all well and good and their opinions were valuable, but let's be honest, I'm a mom of three under the age of five who rarely ventures out of "Auto" mode when it comes to photography. I don't know camera technicalities and I don't have time to learn them right now (though I look forward to the day when I can). I just need a camera that will photograph my kids and, yet, still give me quality images.I found what I was looking for with this camera. The images are sharp and, while it sometimes takes a little longer than I'd like to focus, it still works quicker than my previous point-and-shoot (which often took a full 5-10 seconds to focus and still came out blurry - that doesn't hack it with active kids). Best of all, I used this baby yesterday while attending the birth of a friend, which means, of course, the hospital lighting was less-than-ideal (aka VERY dim) and the photos came out beautifully! There was no grainy texture, no washed out faces. And the zoom worked well enough that I was able to grab close shots of baby without having to stick the camera (and its flash) right in his face.Thus, from a complete amateur's point-of-view, this camera is worth its salt. The panoramic, which I've tried a few times, works great and looks stunning. Macro shots of birthday flowers look professional.My only complaint is how long it takes to view photos. Another reviewer mentioned having to have the camera on to review photos in playback, and this is true (and slightly annoying but not too bad), but what frustrates me is that it takes a full ten-seconds between pushing the play-back button and the images coming up - and if you don't think that sounds like too long, count it out, it's longer than you think and frustrating when you want to check quickly if you got the shot). Clearly, however, this minor flaw is not enough for me to ding the camera even one full star.I love this little guy and I wouldn't trade it.

Reviews.Title: I had higher expectations.
Reviews.Author: ASHLEY
Reviews.Content: THe quality of the photos is great. However, the delay between being able to take photos is extremely long, and it causes you to miss many shots.

Reviews.Title: The camera is okay but the FLASH pops open right where I hold the camera
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: Pictures are good so long as you remember where the flash opens.  I can't tell you how many pictures I've ruined because the flash isn't where it normally is located on other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Cool cool pix
Reviews.Author: Evelyn
Reviews.Content: I have wanted this camera for a while.  The price was terrific.  I love the camera and use it with great pleasure.  The pictures I have taken so far are really superior to my last camera even in low light situations

Reviews.Title: You don't get the charger or case
Reviews.Author: Reclaimed
Reviews.Content: Be warned - this page contains false advertising! We are told in the Product Description under "What's in the Box" that you get the MH-65 Battery Charger, an EH-62F AC Adapter, and a COOLPIX Black Leather Case with your purchase.  Not so! You do get the other items listed, but the cost to purchase the items they advertised but did NOT include is $62.89 (at today's prices).  I've been a faithful fan of Amazon for many years, but this was sure a disappointment.I used four stars because I don't want to lower the camera's rating because of Amazon's error.  It would have been five but I find that at full zoom, it has a problem focusing. You can see it zoom clearly and then blur up again before it allows you to take the photo. If the shot is important and you know you'll only have one shot at it, don't try it on full zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: That One Guy
Reviews.Content: If you know anything about cameras you can read the specs and see that for the price, this is a great camera. If you know nothing about cameras and want a really good camera for this price, buy this camera. The next model up, the 9300, has GPS built in. If you know anything about cameras and you want GPS built in, go buy the 9300. If you know nothing about cameras then you will probably have no idea how to use the GPS in the 9300, buy this camera.It is easy to use, great pictures, true colors, the 18x optical on a compact is awesome, fits in the pocket, if you like to carry a camera in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and operate; video performance very good.  When turned on, the camera emits a startup bell, which is not ideal for close proximity wildlife photography.  Zoom is outstanding, however the viewfinder screen is difficult to see in very bright sunlight if you have sunglasses on. Photos are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Great product, one minor issue
Reviews.Author: Santana
Reviews.Content: This is a good product, good quality, takes beautiful pictures, but the only thing is, for me, takes to much time for the camera to be ready after you took a picture to take another picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Shurlon Peart
Reviews.Content: Wanted a camera and video camera for my wife without having two devices and this did the trick.  The color is great the only hang up is the flash it pops up and your finger is usually in the way.  Other than that love the camera the pictures are so vivided.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S9300 is an amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Wanda A Martin
Reviews.Content: I have another Nikon coolpix camera but was looking for one with a touch screen and a decent zoom....I found out that I couldn't have both so decided the zoom was the most important feature.  I read reviews on lots of cameras with 12 to 20x zooms and the Nikon Coolpix S9300 had the best reviews....all the reviews also said if you were going to capture video, go with a camera that will do 1080 p, this one does and with one touch too!  I wanted both zoom and good one touch video as well as no lag when you snap the digital photo.  This camera lives up to all that.  It takes amazing pictures...has some great features and comes with good software.  It is a little thicker than my other Coolpix but will still fit in your pocket or purse.  If you are going to zoom to the full 18x, you will need a tripod as images can be blurred by movement.  I highly recommed this camera.....and am glad I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Camera took 5 pictures and died each day
Reviews.Author: For What it is Worth... "Just My thoughts"
Reviews.Content: They say never go on vacation with new shoes and a new camera. Now I know why.Camera battery would look full and then took about 5 pictures before it died each day. Each night I charged the camera. Each morning the battery was full and after 5 pictures it went to half life and then died. I ended up using my smart phone for the rest of the trip.

Reviews.Title: Worst Nikon product in decades.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Lecoq
Reviews.Content: Can't be seen in daylight.  Close focus is worthless.  Cannot override focus in unusual situation.  Ruined the pictures from my vacation.  A piece of crap afte nearly 50 years of using Nikon products both as a professional and recreational user.  Would recommend Nikon discontinue this camera as a piece of crap. Do no buy it, you will hate it.  I am a very experienced pro of 50 years experience who bought this as an easy use camera for my wife.  It is crap.  Nikon should discontinue it immediately.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Brower
Reviews.Content: Feature rich and a pleasure to use. Will be teaching my wife how to use it :). She'll like the Fully Automatic mode.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Steve Melton
Reviews.Content: The S9200 Nikon camera is a great value for all the features you receive. The quality is as good as any I have seen in a non SLR camera. The user controls are easy to locate and understand. The features give you everything you need including great video along with the best MP level for this type of camera. The camera also has a great zoom, again one of the best in a non SLR or changeable lens camera. Excellent for a point and shoot camera, easy to carry. I would recommend this to anyone including professionals who want a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cool Pix
Reviews.Author: Sue Menard
Reviews.Content: Was quite the hit as a gift to my son and his wife.  Were totally surprised.  Beautifully clear pic's, easy to operate.  I have the older version, but this one is so much better.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpx
Reviews.Author: Star grazer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great price. This camera takes great pictures, portraits land scapes. Two issues, when you turn it on. Your hand easily blocks the flash, so you have to be carful how you hold it. Secondly, you need to either read the manual or practice shootings learning the Iso's and settings. Or you can just put it in auto focus and shoot.  Professional shots right out of the box!

Reviews.Title: Our second COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: ray of sunshine
Reviews.Content: I already have a Nikon COOLPIX and love it, so I purchased another one as a Christmas gift for my husband. He likes to take pictures with mine and likes the features and results, he will be nicely surprised.

Reviews.Title: Slow and painful
Reviews.Author: W.O.W
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great pictures, so I gave it 2 stars. Other than that, I really dislike this camera. I have to push the power button 2-3 times before it turns on so I have missed multiple picture opportunities. I'm usually in such a panic at that point that I forget about the pop-up flash and it gets stuck under my finger. The top dial that changes the picture type also tuns very easily (like a finger bumping it) and the next picture inevitably ends up in the wrong exposure.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point & shoot cam
Reviews.Author: Cielo Enviado "Engel Gesicht"
Reviews.Content: I am amazed with all the HD pictures I took with this camera.  Not sure why other people gave this cam poor rating, but when I read some of the reviews of the people who sounded like they know what they were talking about, I thought it was worth a try for that price.  And I'm glad I did.  I own a Canon DSLR camera and this is a great purse size camera to carry around without having to worry about picture quality.

Reviews.Title: No Complete Manual
Reviews.Author: Otto Davis
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix S9300 is an outstanding camera and I would recommend it to anyone, I am strictly an amateur photographerand cannot remember all the settings. Most of the settings commonly used can be set before you venture outside to take pictures but if you wanted to make some changes you do not have a complete manual. So my only complaint is I would like Nikon to furnish a complete manual in the language of my choice, English, instead of the bilingual one furnished, Of couse I down loaded the manual off the internet but that doesn't do me any good when I am on a camping or hiking trip.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera if you never want to take pictures. looks great sitting in a draw....
Reviews.Author: account closed
Reviews.Content: peice of crap. less than a year and it only take blurry pictures, and it isnt from a dirty lense. wont focus anymore. GPS function never worked. I guess i should lisyt the good points : the paint never faded..... it has buttons, i like buttons. thats about it.

Reviews.Title: Overrated
Reviews.Author: K. mom
Reviews.Content: This camera was not what  I expected when I looked at the rave reviews, it is disappointing because most of my pics come out blurry

Reviews.Title: Intuitive and easy to master
Reviews.Author: Vincent Hrabrich III
Reviews.Content: I Took this camera to Australia and New Zealand about a week after I purchased it.  This camera is usable in a very intuitive manner.  I took over 1200 photos during a twelve day period down under.  Of those 1200 photos (of course many near duplicates) taken under a variety of different conditions, I have almost 400 photos that consider to be worth the price of the trip and the camera combined.  The videos were simply a handy bonus...all 40 of them.  Very nice pocket sized camera.

Reviews.Title: Will not focus anymore.
Reviews.Author: Joe Reyes
Reviews.Content: I only used this camera twice!Then, when I tried to use it a third time, it will not focus at all.According to the forums that are out on the web, Nikon has a lot of issues with this.Not only with my s9200 model. But with most common Coolpix models.But I was smart a purchased a two year replacement warranty.I am only 7 months into the warranty, so I will be looking to get something else.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: Shelley Williams
Reviews.Content: Had this camera a little over a year and found that every time I went to use it the battery would be dead. Now I sent it in to Nikon for evaluation/repairs, as it would not open .  Am very disappointed that it will cost $150 to repair and it was never dropped or abused. Think I will try another brand rather than have it repaired.

Reviews.Title: broken within a month
Reviews.Author: nicole
Reviews.Content: camera started acting funny after a month. pixelated images and discolorations. Amazon could not help me and nikon has been a pain. paid for it and its sitting broken.

Reviews.Title: Bad camera...
Reviews.Author: Michael Batsu
Reviews.Content: I've bought this camera in June of 2012 at Costco for $330.  I was not too impressed with it from the start and I've made a really bad decision in keeping it instead of returning during the first couple of weeks.  To add insult to injury, the camera stopped working for no reason just two weeks after the 1 year warranty.  Knowing that Costco has a great return policy I thought I could at least return it and get store credit, but they refused to take it back since for the camera/video equipment they have only a 90 day return policy.I see the price dropped considerably to less than $200 since last year; there is a good reason for it.  This camera has a poor design, bad battery life and also poor reliability. I've always believed in Nikon cameras, but not anymore.Do yourself a favor and skip this aggravation.

Reviews.Title: S9200 poor quality photos
Reviews.Author: Peggy Sik
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Nikon S9100.  I dropped it (only about 2 feet onto a grassy surface) and parts started rattling around inside.  Totally broken.  Admittedly my fault for dropping it...but not very durable considering I only dropped it about 2 feet and on to a grassy surface as well.  Not worth the expensive to send it in to fix.  "Upgraded" to the Nikon S9200.  Hate is a strong word...but I really dislike this camera.  The 9200 takes poor clarity photos...no matter what I do the images are blurry.  If any of your subject moves the images are blurry.  Poor photos in low light or indoor settings.  Takes reasonable photos in sunny outdoor settings.  I am now in the market for a new camera...I will let my 8 year old play with this one.  I cannot recommend this camera to anyone and will definitely hesitate buying any Nikon product in the future.

Reviews.Title: wouldnt recomend
Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Rosenbalm "Wildstang"
Reviews.Content: Mine never did take the best pics now it died and I got a cannon so far im pleased with it .this one kept having memory card problems till I had to go get an expensive card that finally worked but I lost so many pics with the card issue over months. then finally it kept saying lens error . My mom has the same camera and is having the same card issues.my husbands cheap sanyo did better than this one ...

Reviews.Title: unreliable!
Reviews.Author: Lorena Tamariz
Reviews.Content: This camera worked in the beginning and then stoped focusing properly on photo and video function. Sign of low battery would appear right after charging it!  After a while could not  turn it on. The lens closure stayed half open/close. Very unreliable product. Not recommended. A special price offer  is never good if the product does not work properly.

Reviews.Title: Terrible. Blurry photo camera only.
Reviews.Author: green salsa
Reviews.Content: Terrible. More blurry photos than decent ones. Took this camera to the independent shop we bought it from as they suggested to 'reset' the settings. Same thing started happening with blurry photos again. This is a point and shoot camera so there should not be a lot of manipulating to just get a standard photo whether you are using a variety of settings or the auto.If you ever plan to take a photo of a child or pet who might be moving slightly definitely do not buy this camera. Don't buy it at all.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Nikon that just up and died...Burial tomorrow in my back yard :(
Reviews.Author: william c fowler
Reviews.Content: This was the second camera that up and died for whatever reason. I WAS IN LOVE WITH BOTH NIKONS...THEIR USER FRIENDLINESS AND FUN AFFECTS...B U T ...this one takes the cake. This one can't be bumped or jiggled or be used at the beach where there is moisture (neither could the other one). IT CANNOT TAKE THE SLIGHTEST BEATING AT ALL! It's so fragile. I was in Beautiful Florida when this happened taking the best picture of the most beautiful moon I have ever seen in my life and all of a sudden it said LENZ ERROR!?!? RU KIDDING? Yep folks. That was the end. My First Nikon lasted ONE DAY AT THE BEACH (although it was a floor model :/ . My 2nd Nikon lasted at least three Months. At Least we bought a 2 yr warranty...WHICH EVERY NIKON BUYER SHOULD ALWAYS BUY!Nikon needs to invent a protector like I-Phones have or something...just in case.

Reviews.Title: about the seller
Reviews.Author: busy girl
Reviews.Content: this review its about the seller not the product itself because I haven't received yet, but I just wanted to say that I bought this item because I've always have  been a fan of Nikon products, I think they have really good quality but also the company that sells and warranties the product matters as well. deals4less has a wonderful customer services.
